snippet: The French bank's third-quarter loss was more than 50% higher than expected, mainly because of costs related to the disposal of its Greek unit.
abstract: Credit Agricole posts unexpectedly large third-quarter loss, mainly from costs related to the sale of its Greek unit; loss was 2.85 billion euros, or $3.6 billion; revenue fell 32 percent, to 3.4 billion euros.
lead_paragraph: The French bank's third-quarter loss was more than 50% higher than expected, mainly because of costs related to the disposal of its Greek unit.

headline.main: Crédit Agricole Posts Unexpectedly Large Loss
headline.print_headline: Loss at Crédit Agricole Tops Estimates
